title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: The data set editor page in the query tab should list the children nodes when changing the data source for a data set.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor for the new data set. 
3. In the data set editor, go to the data source page. 
4. Change the data source to a new one that has no database/table/column information. 
5. Observe that there is no listing of children nodes. 
6. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
